data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قَالَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.
data.sentence: The word بِالْحَقِّ comes from the root ح ق ق and is associated with the meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.

data.meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.
data.sentence: The word الرَّحْمَنُ comes from the root ر ح م and is associated with the meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.

data.meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
data.sentence: The word احْكُمْ comes from the root ح ك م and is associated with the meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.

data.meanings: to be of middle age. yu'inu (vb. 4) - to aid/assist/help. ta'awana (vb. 4) - to help one another. ista'ana (vb. 10) - to implore for help, seek aid, turn and call for assistance. musta'an - one whose help is to be implored.. . A'aana (prf. 3rd. m. sing. vb. IV): helped.. A'iinuu (prt. m. pl. vb. IV): help ye one another.. Ta'aawanuu (prt. m. pl. vb. IV): to help one another.. Nasta'iinuu (imp. 1st. pl. vb. VI): we implore for help.. Ista'iinuu (prt. m. pl. vb. 10): you seek help.. Must'aiinu (pis. pic. m. sing.  vb. 10): one whose help is saught.. 'Awaanun (n.): one of middle age (2:68).
data.sentence: The word الْمُسْتَعَانُ comes from the root ع و ن and is associated with the meanings: to be of middle age. yu'inu (vb. 4) - to aid/assist/help. ta'awana (vb. 4) - to help one another. ista'ana (vb. 10) - to implore for help, seek aid, turn and call for assistance. musta'an - one whose help is to be implored.. . A'aana (prf. 3rd. m. sing. vb. IV): helped.. A'iinuu (prt. m. pl. vb. IV): help ye one another.. Ta'aawanuu (prt. m. pl. vb. IV): to help one another.. Nasta'iinuu (imp. 1st. pl. vb. VI): we implore for help.. Ista'iinuu (prt. m. pl. vb. 10): you seek help.. Must'aiinu (pis. pic. m. sing.  vb. 10): one whose help is saught.. 'Awaanun (n.): one of middle age (2:68).

data.meanings: to describe (good or bad), assert something as a fact, achieve, ascribe, specify.
data.sentence: The word تَصِفُونَ comes from the root و ص ف and is associated with the meanings: to describe (good or bad), assert something as a fact, achieve, ascribe, specify.
